logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: How to make wise decisions

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Across cultures, wisdom has been considered one of the most revered human qualities.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Human characteristics that are deeply respected or admired.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những phẩm chất con người được tôn kính.

phase3Production.content: Compassion is considered one of the most revered human qualities in many religions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although the truly wise may seem few and far between, empirical research examining wisdom suggests that...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning scarce or infrequent.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hiếm có, không thường xuyên.

phase3Production.content: Job opportunities in this small town are few and far between.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...empirical research examining wisdom suggests that it isn’t an exceptional trait...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Research based on observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nghiên cứu thực nghiệm.

phase3Production.content: His conclusions are backed by solid empirical research.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it isn’t an exceptional trait possessed by a small handful of bearded philosophers after all...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A personal quality that is unusually good and stands out from others.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đặc điểm ngoại lệ/nổi bật.

phase3Production.content: Her ability to stay calm under pressure is an exceptional trait.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...most of us have the ability to make wise decisions, given the right context.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: If the circumstances or situation are appropriate.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong bối cảnh phù hợp.

phase3Production.content: Anyone can be creative, given the right context and encouragement.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘It appears that experiential, situational, and cultural factors are even more powerful in shaping wisdom than previously imagined,’...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Influencing the development of the quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Định hình sự khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: Life experiences play a crucial role in shaping wisdom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘Recent empirical findings from cognitive, developmental, social, and personality psychology cumulatively suggest that...’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To indicate or show something as a result of the combined effect of many things.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tích lũy lại cho thấy.

phase3Production.content: The various studies cumulatively suggest a strong link between diet and health.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...people’s ability to reason wisely varies dramatically across experiential and situational contexts.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To think, understand, and form judgments logically and with good sense.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lập luận một cách khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: The judge was known for her ability to reason wisely and fairly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...ability to reason wisely varies dramatically across experiential and situational contexts.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To change or differ in a great and sudden way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thay đổi đột ngột/đáng kể.

phase3Production.content: The weather in the mountains can vary dramatically throughout the day.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Understanding the role of such contextual factors offers unique insights...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Circumstances or conditions that are related to the situation in which something happens.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các yếu tố bối cảnh.

phase3Production.content: When judging someone's actions, it's important to consider all the contextual factors.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...offers unique insights into understanding wisdom in daily life...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mang lại 'cái nhìn sâu sắc' (insights) 'độc đáo' (unique) 'về' (into).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A special and accurate understanding of something that was not clear before.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cái nhìn sâu sắc độc đáo về.

phase3Production.content: The documentary offers unique insights into the life of the artist.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It seems that it’s not so much that some people simply possess wisdom and others lack it...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have or own the quality of being wise.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sở hữu sự khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: She was a leader who seemed to possess great wisdom and foresight.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘In other words, wisdom is not solely an ‘inner quality’ but rather unfolds as a function of situations...’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Chỉ là' (solely) 'một phẩm chất bên trong' (an inner quality).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Only or exclusively a characteristic that exists within a person's mind or character.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chỉ đơn thuần là một 'phẩm chất bên trong'.

phase3Production.content: Success is not solely an inner quality; it also depends on opportunity and luck.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Some situations are more likely to promote wisdom than others.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To encourage the development or increase of wisdom.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thúc đẩy sự khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: Reflecting on one's mistakes can help to promote wisdom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Grossmann and his colleagues have identified four key characteristics as part of a framework of wise reasoning.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'khuôn khổ' (framework) 'của lập luận khôn ngoan' (of wise reasoning).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A basic structure of ideas and principles that supports the process of thinking wisely.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một khuôn khổ của lập luận khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: The course provides a framework of wise reasoning for ethical decision-making.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: One is intellectual humility or recognition of the limits of our own knowledge...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being aware that one's own knowledge is limited and incomplete.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự khiêm tốn về trí tuệ.

phase3Production.content: Great scientists often possess a deep sense of intellectual humility.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...another is appreciation of perspectives wider than the issue at hand.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'trân trọng/thấu hiểu' (appreciation) 'các quan điểm' (of perspectives).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Understanding and recognition of the value of different points of view.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự trân trọng các quan điểm.

phase3Production.content: Effective leadership requires an appreciation of perspectives from all team members.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: Sensitivity to the possibility of change
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Sensitivity to the possibility of change in social relations is also key...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự nhạy bén' (Sensitivity) 'với' (to) 'khả năng thay đổi' (the possibility of change).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being aware of and responsive to the potential for things to alter.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự nhạy bén với khả năng thay đổi.

phase3Production.content: A good manager has a sensitivity to the possibility of change in the market.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...along with compromise or integration of different attitudes and beliefs.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An agreement reached by each side making concessions, or the process of combining different things into a whole.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thỏa hiệp hoặc hợp nhất.

phase3Production.content: The final plan was a result of compromise and integration of everyone's suggestions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to look at scenarios from a third-party perspective, as though giving advice to a friend.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A point of view from someone who is not directly involved in a situation.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Góc nhìn của bên thứ ba.

phase3Production.content: It's often helpful to get a third-party perspective on your problems.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Research suggests that when adopting a first-person viewpoint we focus on ‘the focal features of the environment’...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The central and most important aspects or characteristics.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các đặc điểm trọng tâm.

phase3Production.content: The focal features of the investigation were the suspect's alibi and motive.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and when we adopt a third-person, ‘observer’ viewpoint we reason more broadly...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chúng ta 'lập luận' (reason) 'một cách rộng hơn' (more broadly).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To think and form judgments in a more comprehensive and inclusive way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lập luận rộng hơn.

phase3Production.content: Taking a step back allows you to see the problem and reason more broadly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and focus more on interpersonal and moral ideals such as justice and impartiality.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Principles or values relating to right and wrong that are considered perfect or worth aiming for.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các lý tưởng đạo đức.

phase3Production.content: He lived his life according to high moral ideals.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...moral ideals such as justice and impartiality.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of not supporting any of the sides involved in an argument; fairness.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự công bằng, vô tư.

phase3Production.content: Judges are expected to act with complete impartiality.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Looking at problems from this more expansive viewpoint appears to foster cognitive processes related to wise decisions.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To encourage the development of mental processes of perception, memory, judgment, and reasoning.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thúc đẩy các quá trình nhận thức.

phase3Production.content: Reading books from a young age can foster cognitive processes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: What are we to do, then, when confronted with situations like a disagreement with a spouse...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be faced with or have to deal with a difficult situation.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đối mặt với.

phase3Production.content: When confronted with a problem, it's best to address it directly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that require us to take a personal stake?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Yêu cầu chúng ta 'có lợi ích/rủi ro cá nhân' (take a personal stake).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a personal interest or involvement in a situation, often with something to gain or lose.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có lợi ích/rủi ro cá nhân trong đó.

phase3Production.content: As a parent, I take a personal stake in the quality of our local schools.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: peak of a recent economic recession
lexicalItems.sourceContext: For example, in one experiment that took place during the peak of a recent economic recession, graduating college seniors were asked to reflect on their job prospects.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đỉnh điểm' (peak) 'của một cuộc suy thoái' (recession) 'kinh tế' (economic) 'gần đây' (recent).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The worst point of a recent period of reduced economic activity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đỉnh điểm của một cuộc suy thoái kinh tế gần đây.

phase3Production.content: Many people lost their jobs during the peak of the last economic recession.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...graduating college seniors were asked to reflect on their job prospects.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The chances or opportunities for future success in a career.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Triển vọng nghề nghiệp.

phase3Production.content: His job prospects improved significantly after he got his master's degree.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The students were instructed to imagine their career either ‘as if you were a distant observer’ or ‘before your own eyes as if you were right there’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Someone who is watching a situation from a detached, uninvolved perspective.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một người quan sát từ xa.

phase3Production.content: He tried to analyze the argument like a distant observer, without taking sides.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...than did participants in the control group.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The group in an experiment or study that does not receive treatment by the researchers and is then used as a benchmark to measure how the other tested subjects do.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhóm đối chứng.

phase3Production.content: The new drug's effectiveness was measured by comparing the patients' recovery to that of the control group.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In another study, couples in long-term romantic relationships were instructed to visualize an unresolved relationship conflict...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Romantic partnerships that have continued for a significant period of time.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các mối quan hệ lãng mạn lâu dài.

phase3Production.content: The study focused on communication patterns in long-term romantic relationships.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to visualize an unresolved relationship conflict either through the eyes of an outsider or from their own perspective.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'xung đột' (conflict) 'trong mối quan hệ' (relationship) 'chưa được giải quyết' (unresolved).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A disagreement or argument in a relationship that has not been settled or concluded.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xung đột trong mối quan hệ chưa được giải quyết.

phase3Production.content: The therapist helped them discuss an unresolved relationship conflict from their past.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: through the eyes of an outsider
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...visualize an unresolved relationship conflict either through the eyes of an outsider or from their own perspective.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Qua con mắt' (through the eyes) 'của người ngoài cuộc' (of an outsider).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: From the point of view of someone not directly involved.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Qua con mắt của người ngoài cuộc.

phase3Production.content: Try to see the situation through the eyes of an outsider to be more objective.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Couples in the ‘other’s eyes’ condition were significantly more likely to rely on wise reasoning...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Có khả năng cao hơn đáng kể' (significantly more likely).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having a much greater probability or chance of happening.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có khả năng cao hơn đáng kể.

phase3Production.content: People who exercise regularly are significantly more likely to live longer.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...recognizing others’ perspectives and searching for a compromise...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tìm kiếm' (searching for) 'một sự thỏa hiệp' (a compromise).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Trying to find a middle ground or an agreement where both sides make concessions.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tìm kiếm sự thỏa hiệp.

phase3Production.content: Instead of arguing, they started searching for a compromise that would satisfy them both.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...compared to the couples in the egocentric condition.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Điều kiện' (condition) 'vị kỷ/lấy mình làm trung tâm' (egocentric).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The experimental situation where participants were asked to think about things only from their own point of view.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Điều kiện vị kỷ.

phase3Production.content: Participants in the egocentric condition were less likely to consider their partner's feelings.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘Ego-decentering promotes greater focus on others and enables a bigger picture, conceptual view of the experience...’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự phân tâm khỏi cái tôi/giảm tính vị kỷ' (Ego-decentering).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of moving away from a self-centered perspective to consider the views of others and the broader context.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự phi tâm hóa cái tôi.

phase3Production.content: Practicing empathy is a key part of ego-decentering.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...enables a bigger picture, conceptual view of the experience...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cho phép có một cái nhìn' (enables) 'toàn cảnh hơn' (a bigger picture).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make it possible to see or understand the overall situation, not just the details.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cho phép có một cái nhìn tổng thể hơn.

phase3Production.content: Stepping back from the details enables a bigger picture of the entire project.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...affording recognition of intellectual humility and change,’ says Grossmann.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Mang lại/tạo cơ hội' (affording) 'sự công nhận' (recognition of).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Providing or making it possible to acknowledge or accept something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mang lại sự công nhận.

phase3Production.content: The open discussion format is good for affording recognition of different viewpoints.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We might associate wisdom with intelligence or particular personality traits...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person's particular qualities of character.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những đặc điểm tính cách.

phase3Production.content: Shyness is a common personality trait, but it can be overcome.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a small positive relationship between wise thinking and crystallized intelligence...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The ability to use learned knowledge and experience.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trí thông minh kết tinh.

phase3Production.content: Vocabulary and general knowledge are examples of crystallized intelligence.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the personality traits of openness and agreeableness.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The personality traits of being open to new experiences and being cooperative and compassionate towards others.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự cởi mở và sự dễ chịu.

phase3Production.content: Her high scores in openness and agreeableness suggest she works well in teams.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘It is remarkable how much people can vary in their wisdom from one situation to the next...’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: It is surprising or worthy of attention how...
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thật đáng chú ý là.

phase3Production.content: It is remarkable how quickly the city has changed in just ten years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...wise judgment and its social and affective outcomes as compared to the generalized ‘traits’.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'kết quả' (outcomes) 'về mặt xã hội' (social) 'và' (and) 'tình cảm' (affective).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The results or consequences related to social interactions and emotions.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các kết quả về mặt xã hội và tình cảm.

phase3Production.content: The study measured both the academic and the social and affective outcomes of the new teaching method.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as compared to the generalized ‘traits’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Broad personal qualities that are assumed to be stable across all situations.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các 'đặc điểm' tổng quát.

phase3Production.content: Psychology has moved from focusing on generalized 'traits' to looking at behavior in specific contexts.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘That is, knowing how wisely a person behaves in a given situation is more informative...’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một người 'hành xử' (behaves) 'trong một tình huống' (in a situation) 'nhất định' (given).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: How a person acts in a specific circumstance.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hành xử trong một tình huống nhất định.

phase3Production.content: It is hard to predict how a person behaves in a given situation of extreme stress.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is more informative for understanding their emotions or likelihood to forgive...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cung cấp nhiều thông tin hơn' (more informative).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Providing more useful or interesting information.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhiều thông tin hơn.

phase3Production.content: The second report was much more informative than the first one.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...likelihood to forgive [or] retaliate as compared to knowing whether the person may be wise ‘in general’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The probability that someone will stop feeling angry or resentful towards someone for an offense.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khả năng tha thứ.

phase3Production.content: Studies show a link between empathy and a greater likelihood to forgive others.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...likelihood to forgive [or] retaliate as compared to knowing whether the person may be wise ‘in general’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make an attack in return for a similar attack; to take revenge.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trả đũa.

phase3Production.content: If you attack them, they will surely retaliate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as compared to knowing whether the person may be wise ‘in general’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Being wise as a general, stable personality trait, rather than in specific situations.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khôn ngoan 'nói chung'.

phase3Production.content: He may be smart, but it's debatable whether he is wise in general.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...support wisdom in our own day-to-day decisions...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Decisions that are made as part of a normal daily routine.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các quyết định hàng ngày.

phase3Production.content: Financial literacy is important for making good day-to-day decisions about money.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Looking at problems from this more expansive viewpoint appears to foster cognitive processes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A broad and wide-ranging point of view.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Góc nhìn mở rộng.

phase3Production.content: Traveling helps to develop a more expansive viewpoint on life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...situations like a disagreement with a spouse or negotiating a contract at work...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An argument or difference of opinion with one's husband or wife.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự bất đồng với vợ/chồng.

phase3Production.content: He had a minor disagreement with his spouse about where to go for dinner.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Participants in the group assigned to the ‘distant observer’ role displayed more wisdom-related reasoning...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'phân công' (assigned to) 'vai trò' (the role) 'người quan sát từ xa' (distant observer).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Given the task of acting as a detached onlooker.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được giao vai trò 'người quan sát từ xa'.

phase3Production.content: In the experiment, I was assigned to the 'distant observer' role for the conflict scenario.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...displayed more wisdom-related reasoning (intellectual humility and recognition of change) than did participants in the control group.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Thể hiện' (displayed) 'nhiều hơn' (more) 'lý luận liên quan đến sự khôn ngoan' (wisdom-related reasoning).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Showed a greater amount of thinking that is characteristic of wisdom.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thể hiện nhiều hơn lý luận liên quan đến sự khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: The students who took the philosophy class displayed more wisdom-related reasoning in their essays.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Participants then discussed the incident with their partner for 10 minutes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Talked about a particular event or occurrence.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thảo luận về sự việc.

phase3Production.content: The manager discussed the incident with the employees involved.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...enables a bigger picture, conceptual view of the experience...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An understanding of something based on abstract ideas or principles.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cái nhìn khái niệm.

phase3Production.content: The course helps students develop a conceptual view of physics, not just memorize formulas.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...research shows only a small positive relationship between wise thinking and crystallized intelligence...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chỉ có 'một mối quan hệ' (a relationship) 'tích cực' (positive) 'nhỏ' (small).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A slight but direct correlation between two variables (as one increases, the other tends to increase slightly).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một mối quan hệ tích cực nhỏ.

phase3Production.content: The study found a small positive relationship between hours spent studying and exam scores.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: from one situation to the next
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how much people can vary in their wisdom from one situation to the next...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Từ tình huống này sang tình huống khác' (from one situation to the next).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Across different circumstances or contexts.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Từ tình huống này sang tình huống khác.

phase3Production.content: His mood seems to change dramatically from one situation to the next.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although the truly wise may seem few and far between...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People who genuinely possess deep understanding, experience, and good judgment.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những người thực sự khôn ngoan.

phase3Production.content: The truly wise understand the limits of their own knowledge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...factors are even more powerful in shaping wisdom than previously imagined...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'sức ảnh hưởng/mạnh mẽ' (powerful) 'trong việc định hình' (in shaping).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having a great effect on the development or form of something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có ảnh hưởng lớn trong việc định hình.

phase3Production.content: Early childhood experiences are powerful in shaping our personalities.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...our ability to reason wisely depends on a variety of external factors.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be controlled or determined by a range of different things.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phụ thuộc vào nhiều.

phase3Production.content: Success in this field depends on a variety of skills, not just one.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...wisdom... unfolds as a function of situations people happen to be in.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bộc lộ/diễn ra' (unfolds) 'như là một hệ quả của' (as a function of).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To develop or be revealed as a direct result of something else.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Diễn ra như một hệ quả của.

phase3Production.content: A child's personality unfolds as a function of both genetics and environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...recognition of the limits of our own knowledge...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Giới hạn' (limits) 'kiến thức của chính chúng ta' (of our own knowledge).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The point at which one's own understanding and information ends.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giới hạn kiến thức của bản thân.

phase3Production.content: A wise person is aware of the limits of their own knowledge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...perspectives wider than the issue at hand.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Vấn đề' (issue) 'đang được xem xét/trước mắt' (at hand).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The current problem or topic being discussed.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vấn đề trước mắt.

phase3Production.content: Let's focus on the issue at hand and not get distracted by other topics.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...integration of different attitudes and beliefs.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Various ways of thinking or feeling about someone or something, and different convictions that something is true.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các thái độ và niềm tin khác nhau.

phase3Production.content: A multicultural society is made up of people with many different attitudes and beliefs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Grossmann and his colleagues have also found that one of the most reliable ways to support wisdom...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một trong những 'cách' (ways) 'đáng tin cậy nhất' (most reliable).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most consistently good or dependable methods.
